summary: An FBI 302 report documenting an interview with a security guard hired for Little St. James island. The guard was hired through Michael Turnball and started work on August 12, 2019, securing the docks. She stated she had never met Jeffrey Epstein nor seen him on St. Thomas.

persons.name: Michael Turnball
persons.role: Contact for security job on Little St. James
persons.context: The interviewee heard about the security job from a friend who worked with Turnball, and called him to inquire about openings.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Owner of Little St. James island
persons.context: The interviewee stated she had never met Epstein nor seen him on St. Thomas, despite working security on his private island.

connections.description: Turnball appears to be involved in hiring security personnel for Epstein's private island, Little St. James.

events.title: FBI interview of security guard
events.description: An FBI agent interviewed a security guard on Little St. James island regarding her hiring and duties.

events.title: Security guard starts work on Little St. James
events.description: The interviewee began her first day working security on Little St. James, tasked with securing the docks.

events.title: Initial contact for security job
events.description: The interviewee called Michael Turnball on either August 8 or 9, 2019, to inquire about security job openings on Little St. James.

keyFacts: A security guard was hired for Little St. James island through Michael Turnball, starting work on August 12, 2019.
The guard's role was to secure the docks and prevent tourists from coming onto the island, though they could pass through nearby waters.
The guard stated she had never met Jeffrey Epstein nor seen him on St. Thomas.
Prior to this job, the guard worked for the Port Authority and observed boats coming and going from Little St. James.
The interview was conducted by the FBI on Little St. James as part of an investigation.
